de.feu.propra15.q9278273.algorithm

Class HullCalculator

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.feu.propra15.q9278273.algorithm.HullCalculator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    de.feu.propra15.interfaces.IHullCalculator

    public class HullCalculator
extends java.lang.Object
implements de.feu.propra15.interfaces.IHullCalculator
    The Class HullCalculator. It implements the convex hull calculator algorithm and computes the convex set from a given set of points.
    Author:
    Teodor Shaterov

        public void addPointsFromFile(java.lang.String fileName)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Add points from a file to the set of all points. All lines, which aren't containing coordinates with the format "x y" delimited by a space, are ignored
        Specified by:

      • getConvexHull

        public int[][] getConvexHull()
        It clears the convex and angle hulls at first, then computes them with computeConvexHull() and computeAngleHull(double alpha) methods and then puts the result of the convex hull to an array.
        Specified by:
        getConvexHull in interface de.feu.propra15.interfaces.IHullCalculator
        Returns:
        the int array with the coordinates of all points which are forming the convex set
        See Also:
        IHullCalculator.getConvexHull()

      • computeConvexHull

        public void computeConvexHull()
        The method which computes the convex hull from the given points. After the execution of this method, the List convexHull is filled with the points which are forming the convex set. The algorithm computes the convex hull after it divides the set of points to upper and lower hull and then it iterates over the points and put the to the convex set.

      • fillHullHalf

        private int fillHullHalf(java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Point> sortedPoints,
               java.awt.Point[] hull,
               int size,
               int i)
        Fills the upper or lower half of the convex hull.
        Parameters:
        sortedPoints - ArrayList with all points sorted by their X coordinates.
        hull - the hull half which would be filled
        size - the size
        i - the index of the sorted points
        Returns:

      • computeAngleHull

        public void computeAngleHull(double alpha)
        Computes angle hull for the given convex hull and the given angle alpha. It uses the angle hull algorithm with the help of the angle compare test.
        Parameters:
        alpha - the alpha angle in grads

      • angleCompareTest

        public boolean angleCompareTest(java.awt.Point a,
                       java.awt.Point b,
                       java.awt.Point c,
                       java.awt.Point d,
                       double angle)
        Angle compare test. It compares the angle between the lines AB and DC. If the angle is bigger or equal the angle given as a parameter, it returns true.
        Parameters:
        a - Point A
        b - Point B
        c - Point C
        d - Point D
        angle - the angle
        Returns:
        true, if angle between the lines is bigger or equal the parameter

      • arcCalculation

        private void arcCalculation(java.awt.Point a,
                  java.awt.Point b,
                  double alpha,
                  double deltaS,
                  double deltaE)
        Arc calculation. It calculates the arc from (A, B and Alpha) to (Z, r, Sigma and Beta)
        Parameters:
        a - Point A
        b - Point B
        alpha - the angle alpha
        deltaS - the angle deltaS used for the arcs intersection
        deltaE - the angle detlaE used for the arcs intersection
